Description.Title: Alistipes putredinis DSM 17216

Comment.Paragraph: Alistipes putredinis (GenBank Accession Number for 16S rDNA gene: L16497) is a member of the Bacteroidetes division of the domain bacteria and has been isolated from human feces. It has been found in 16S rDNA sequence-based enumerations of the colonic microbiota of adult humans (Eckburg et. al. (2005), Ley et. al. (2006)).

Attributes.Attribute: DSM 17216, CCUG 45780, CIP 104286, ATCC 29800, Carlier 10203, VPI 3293

Description.Title: Anaerotruncus colihominis DSM 17241

Comment.Paragraph: Anaerotruncus colihominis (GenBank Accession Number for 16S rDNA gene: AJ315980) is a member of the Firmicutes division of the domain bacteria and has been isolated from human feces. It has been found in 16S rDNA sequence-based enumerations of the colonic microbiota of adult humans (Eckburg et. al. (2005), Ley et. al. (2006)).

Description.Title: MIGS Cultured Bacterial/Archaeal sample from Bacteroides stercoris ATCC 43183
Generic sample from Biomphalaria glabrata
Generic sample from Callithrix jacchus
Clostridium ramosum DSM 1402

Comment.Paragraph: Clostridium ramosum (GenBank Accession Number for 16S rDNA gene: X73440) is a member of the Firmicutes division of the domain bacteria and has been isolated from human adult as well as infant feces.

Description.Title: MIGS Cultured Bacterial/Archaeal sample from Dorea formicigenerans ATCC 27755

Comment.Paragraph: Dorea formicigenerans (GenBank Accession Number for 16S rRNA gene: L34619) is a member of the Firmicutes division of the domain bacteria. In one comprehensive 16S rDNA sequence- based enumeration of the colonic microbiota of three healthy adult humans, it represents, on average, 0.617% of all 16S rDNA sequences and 1.215% of the sequences in its division (Eckburg et. al. (2005)).

Description.Title: Generic sample from Monodelphis domestica
Generic sample from Ruminococcus sp. GM2/1
Generic sample from Roseburia faecis M72/1

Comment.Paragraph: Roseburia faecis M72/1 (GenBank Accession Number for 16S rDNA gene: AY305310) is a member of the division Firmicutes. In one comprehensive 16S rDNA sequence-based enumeration of the colonic microbiota of three healthy adult humans, it represents, on average, 0.355% of all 16S rDNA sequences and 0.699% of the sequences in its division (Eckburg et. al. (2005)).

Description.Title: Catenibacterium mitsuokai DSM 15897

Comment.Paragraph: Catenibacterium mitsuokai (GenBank Accession Number for 16S rDNA gene: AB030221) is a member of the Firmicutes division of the domain bacteria. In one comprehensive 16S rDNA sequence-based enumeration of the colonic microbiota of three healthy adult humans, it represents, on average, 0.482% of all 16S rDNA sequences and 0.095% of the sequences in its division (Eckburg et. al. (2005)).

Description.Title: Generic sample from Physarum polycephalum

Comment.Paragraph: DNA is in house and was prepared from haploid amoebe provided by the laboratory of Gerard Pierrion.

Description.Title: Bacteroides coprocola DSM 17136

Comment.Paragraph: Bacteroides coprocola (GenBank Accession Number for 16S rDNA gene: AB200224) is a member of the Bacteroidetes division of the domain bacteria and has been isolated from human feces.

Description.Title: Bacteroides intestinalis DSM 17393

Comment.Paragraph: Bacteroides intestinalis (GenBank Accession Number for 16S rDNA gene: AB214328) is a member of the Bacteroidetes division of the domain bacteria and has been isolated from human feces.

Description.Title: MIGS Cultured Bacterial/Archaeal sample from Coprococcus comes ATCC 27758

Comment.Paragraph: Coprococcus comes (16S rDNA gene sequence is not available) is a member of the Firmicutes division of the domain bacteria and has been isolated from human feces.

Comment.Paragraph: Streptococcus infantarius (16S rDNA gene sequence is not available) is a member of the Firmicutes division of the domain bacteria and has been isolated from human feces.

Comment.Paragraph: Clostridium sporogenes (GenBank Accession Number for 16S rDNA gene: DQ911258*) is a member of the Firmicutes division of the domain bacteria and has been isolated from human feces.

Description.Title: MIGS Cultured Bacterial/Archaeal sample from Proteus penneri ATCC 35198

Comment.Paragraph: Proteus penneri (GenBank Accession Number for 16S rDNA gene: DQ885258*) is a member of the Proteobacteria division of the domain bacteria and has been isolated from human feces.

Comment.Paragraph: Providencia stuartii (16S rDNA gene sequence is not available) is a member of the Proteobacteria division of the domain bacteria and has been isolated from human feces.

Comment.Paragraph: Bifidobacterium dentium (16S rDNA gene sequence is not available) is a member of the Actinobacteria division of the domain bacteria and has been isolated from human feces.
